column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/b1b9c762623c392ac665ecdc315e1d2073eaac43 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
I agree that it _seems_ like it would be faster and smaller...  Need numbers etc.\n

Agreed, generally a reasonable amount of arithmetic is faster than LUTs on modern hardware (memory access is such a bottleneck), and this is a single shift.

The code also looks better this way (IMO).

Still, if the claim is that this makes it faster, it's nice to have numbers :-)
Meh, I'm sure this at least doesn't make it slower, it's a trivial change that is easy to understand, and makes the code shorter and easier to understand. Let's just merge it...\n
